name: Airbus A319
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 7,900L water. Discharge: 3,000 L/min. Focus on overwing exits for rapid egress; ensure slides are disarmed before exterior handle pull.

name: Airbus A320
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 7,900L water. Discharge: 3,000 L/min. High-pressure oxygen bottles located in forward cargo hold.

name: Airbus A321
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 12,100L water. Discharge: 5,300 L/min. Stretched fuselage hazard; center-tank fires pose structural risk.

name: Airbus A380
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 32,300L water. Discharge: 11,200 L/min. Double-deck evacuation hazard. GLARE skin is fire-resistant but difficult to penetrate.

name: Boeing 747-8F
description: Freighter config. Primary rescue entry via upper deck. No windows on main deck for entry; focus on nose-door and upper-deck access.

name: Boeing 767-300
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 18,200L water. Discharge: 7,200 L/min. Widebody narrow-aisle layout; evacuation slides are dual-lane.

name: Boeing 777-200
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 24,300L water. Discharge: 9,000 L/min. Twin-engine long-range widebody. Large fuel volume in wing tanks.

name: Beechcraft King Air
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 1,200L water. Discharge: 820 L/min. Beware of rotating propellers on approach. Battery master in overhead panel.

name: Douglas DC-3
description: Vintage tail-dragger. Risk of fuel spill from carburetors. No composite hazards. Magnesium engine components possible.

name: Airbus H135 (EC135)
description: ICAO Heliport Cat H2. Rear clamshell doors for stretcher access. Fenestron tail rotor is shrouded for safety.

name: B-2 Spirit
description: Stealth Bomber. DANGER: Extensive RAM (Radar Absorbent Material) - toxic if burning. Cockpit egress is through the underside hatch.

name: F-35 Lightning II
description: Tactical Stealth. DANGER: CFRP composite dust if burning. External canopy release on port side under access panel.

name: F-22 Raptor
description: Air Superiority Stealth. DANGER: Stealth coatings toxic when burning. Oxygen system (OBOGS) hazard. Ejector seat hazard.

name: F-16 Fighting Falcon
description: Multi-role Fighter. CRITICAL: EPU uses Hydrazine (highly toxic). Canopy jettison is explosive. Port-side external release.

name: F-15 Eagle
description: Air Superiority. Hazards: Live missiles, high-pressure hydraulics, and liquid oxygen (LOX). Armed ejector seats.

name: Eurofighter Typhoon
description: Swing-role fighter. Hazards: Carbon fiber, high-pressure LOX. Canopy release accessible from port side ground level.

name: Saab Gripen
description: Multi-role. Hazards: Delta-canard airframe uses large percentage of composites. Live internal cannon and wing ordnance.

name: Dassault Rafale M
description: Carrier-based multi-role. DANGER: Arresting hook and catapult hardware. Magnesium landing gear. Live ordnance.

name: Dassault Mirage 2000
description: Delta-wing fighter. Hazard: Single-engine turbine failure fragments. Ejector seat and live munitions.

name: MiG-29 Fulcrum
description: Front-line fighter. DANGER: K-36 ejector seat is highly powerful. Twin-engine hazard. Live ordnance.

name: A400M Atlas
description: Strategic-tactical airlifter. Counter-rotating composite propellers. High-pressure oxygen bottles in forward fuselage.

name: C-17 Globemaster III
description: Strategic Transport. APU in right wheel well sponson. Massive fuel capacity in wings. Rear ramp is primary egress.

name: C-130 Hercules
description: Tactical Airlifter. High-wing design. Defensive flare dispensers are a pyrotechnic hazard during rescue.

name: Embraer KC-390
description: Multi-mission Tanker/Transport. Fly-by-wire controls. High-pressure LOX system. Rear ramp and side para-doors for egress.

name: CH-47 Chinook
description: Tandem Rotor. Fuel in side sponsons. DANGER: Low-swinging blades during shutdown. Engine fire access on top deck.

name: AH-64D Apache
description: Attack Helicopter. DANGER: Live ordnance/rockets. Canopy jettison uses explosive charges. High RF hazard from Longbow radar.

name: V-22 Osprey
description: Tiltrotor. High downwash. Engine nacelles contain high-temperature components. Prop-rotors present severe approach hazard.

name: E-7 Wedgetail
description: Tactical AEW&C. MESA radar on top affects structural integrity and rescue entry. High RF radiation hazard.

name: Airseeker (RC-135W)
description: SIGINT platform. High-density mission crew cabin. Avoid boarding while systems are active due to RF/Cooling hazards.

name: BAe Hawk
description: Jet Trainer. DANGER: Ejector seats (Mk.10) must be pinned. Canopy jettison is explosive. High-pressure hydraulics.

name: Voyager (A330 MRTT)
description: Strategic Tanker. Massive center/wing fuel load. Refueling pods on wings. Mission consoles on flight deck.

name: Lynx Wildcat
description: Multi-role Helicopter. Hazards: Live anti-ship missiles. High-speed rotor fragments in engine failure. Composite tail boom.

name: Grob Tutor
description: Elementary trainer. Fully composite (GFRP). Fire causes rapid structural failure. No ejector seats.

name: Protector RG1
description: MALE RPAS. Hazards: Satellite dish high-intensity RF. Live precision ordnance. Sever engine links if responding while engine runs.

name: F/A18 Hornet
description: Carrier Fighter. Hazard: Arresting hook hardware, live wing-tip ordnance. Magnesium landing gear components (flammable).

name: AIM-9M Sidewinder
description: IR Guided Munition. DANGER: Toxic smoke hazard if ignited. High-speed fragmentation on cook-off. Approach from rear/sides only.

name: GBU-31 JDAM
description: GPS Guided. EXTREME EXPLOSIVE HAZARD. In case of fire, evacuate 1000m. Thermal coating may delay cook-off but increases blast pressure.

name: Storm Shadow
description: Cruise Missile. Dual-stage warhead. Contains volatile jet fuel (JP-10) and heavy explosives. Firefighting requires massive foam application.

name: AGM-114 Hellfire
description: Anti-Armor missile. Targeted shape-charge jet hazard. High velocity cook-off risk for motor assembly.

name: Paveway II/III
description: Laser Guided Bomb. Ensure guidance fins are locked before moving. High blast/fragmentation hazard.

name: AIM-120 AMRAAM
description: Radar Guided. Proximity fuse hazard. Stay clear of nose cone assembly during salvage.
